special_cp.overview: Raichu's has 2467 max CP (at Level 50). A Raichu obtained from Raids can be encountered from 1180 CP to 1247 CP, or if weather boosted, in the 1476 CP to 1558 CP range. In Field and Special Research, Raichu can be found in the 885 CP to 935 CP range.
more_info: Field and Special Research encounters are always Level 15. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Field Research encounters have a 10/10/10 IV floor.
Pok√©mon hatched from Eggs are always Level 20. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Egg Hatches have a 10/10/10 IV floor.
Raid Bosses caught without weather boost are always Level 20. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Raid Catches have a 10/10/10 IV floor. üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.

Raid Bosses caught with weather boost are always Level 25. IVs range from 10 (min) to 15 (max). Weather boosted Raid Catches have a 10/10/10 IV floor. üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
üòà Shadow Pok√©mon have 6/6/6 IV floor in raids.
Wild encounters range from Level 1 to Level 30 Pok√©mon. Their IVs range from 0 (min) to 15 (max) for each stat.

Weather Boosted wild Pok√©mon encounters get a 5 Level boost, bringing their Level range to Level 6 to Level 35. In addition, they have a guaraneed minimum IV value of 4 for each stat, resulting in a 4/4/4 IV floor.

meta_analysis: Raichu in the meta PvE Analysis Raichu is often ignored courtesy of its iconic pre-evolution, Pikachu . Sadly, there's no revenge arc for Raichu as it's just plain bad in PvE . ‚öîÔ∏è Raids - Not powerful enough as a Raid counter üò© üõ°Ô∏è Gyms - It doesn't work out . mega_boost.title: Mega Pok√©mon that boost Raichu
mega_boost.intro_text: A list of Mega Pok√©mon that boost Raichu's Electric-type moves, Candy, and Candy XL from catching Raichu.

bonus_info.raid_bonus: Mega and Primal Raid Bonus ‚Äì Mega Pok√©mon boost the attack power of all other Pok√©mon when battling in Raid Battles by 10%. Attacks that share their type with the Mega Pok√©mon's type(s) receive a 30% boost. However, these bonuses do not stack if there are multiple Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon battling simultaneously; only the higher boost will be applied.
bonus_info.catch_bonus: Mega and Primal Catch Bonus ‚Äì While a Pok√©mon is Mega-Evolved, additional XP and Candy is granted when catching a Pok√©mon that shares a type with it, or for any raid boss caught. These do not stack with each other. Additionally, High and Max Level Mega-Evolved Pok√©mon grant an increased chance to obtain Candy XL when catching a Pok√©mon that shares a type with it.

size_info.description: Raichu's height ranges from 0.39 m to 1.4 m, with the average being 0.8 m. The illustration shows a comparison with a 1.70 m (5‚Ä≤07‚Ä≥) tall Trainer. Max height has been limited to 450px for rendering purposes.

pokedex.entry: Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high voltage power.
When electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes feisty. It also glows in the dark.
When its electric ity builds, its muscles are stimu lated, and it be comes more aggres sive than usual.
If the electric pouches in its cheeks become fully charged, both ears will stand straight up.
If its electric pouches run empty, it raises its tail to gather electri city from the atmosphere.
If the electrical sacks become excessively charged, RAICHU plants its tail in the ground and discharges. Scorched patches of ground will be found near this POK√©MON‚Äôs nest.
This POK√©MON exudes a weak electrical charge from all over its body that makes it take on a slight glow in darkness. RAICHU searches for electricity by planting its tail in the ground.
If it stores too much electricity, its behavior turns aggressive. To avoid this, it occasionally discharges excess energy and calms itself down.
Its electric charges can reach even 100,000 volts. Careless contact can cause even an Indian elephant to faint.
Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.
It turns aggressive if it has too much electricity in its body. It discharges power through its tail.
It can loose 100,000-volt bursts of electricity, instantly downing foes several times its size.
Its tail discharges electricity into the ground, protecting it from getting shocked.
When its electricity builds, its muscles are stimulated, and it becomes more aggressive than usual.

If the electrical sacs become excessively charged, Raichu plants its tail in the ground and discharges. Scorched patches of ground will be found near this Pok√©mon‚Äôs nest.
This Pok√©mon exudes a weak electrical charge from all over its body that makes it take on a slight glow in darkness. Raichu plants its tail in the ground to discharge electricity.
It unleashes electric shocks that can reach 100,000 volts. When agitated, it can knock out even an Indian elephant.
It becomes aggressive when it has electricity stored up. At such times, even its Trainer has to take care to avoid being attacked.
As electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes more aggressive. One theory is that the electricity buildup is actually causing stress.
Because so many Trainers like the way Pikachu looks, you don‚Äôt see this Pok√©mon very often.
When electricity builds up inside its body, it becomes feisty. It also glows in the dark.
Its long tail serves as a ground to protect itself from its own high-voltage power.
If its electric pouches run empty, it raises its tail to gather electricity from the atmosphere.
It can discharge bursts of electricity exceeding 100,000 volts‚Äî a single strike with that amount of power would incapacitate one of the Copperajah of my homeland.

faq.question: What are Raichu‚Äôs strengths and weaknesses?
faq.answer: As a Electric-type Pok√©mon, Raichu is weak to Ground-type moves.

faq.question: What are the best moves for Raichu in Pok√©mon GO?
faq.answer: The best moves for Raichu in Pok√©mon GO are Thunder Shock and Wild Charge. This moveset has a DPS (Damage Per Second) of 11.183 and a TDO (Total Damage Output) of 147.092.

faq.question: How does Raichu perform in Raids?
faq.answer: Raichu's Raid attacker tier is currently not known, has no viable moves, or it is too low to be ranked.

faq.question: How does Raichu rank as a Electric-type attacker?
faq.answer: Raichu is an F-Tier Electric-type attacker and not recommended for Raid battles.

faq.question: What Mega Pok√©mon boost Raichu?
faq.answer: The following Mega Pok√©mon boost Raichu: Mega Ampharos, Mega Manectric, and Primal Kyogre.

faq.question: What is Raichu‚Äôs maximum CP at Level 40 and Level 50?
faq.answer: Raichu‚Äôs maximum CP at Level 40 is 2182 CP and 2467 CP at Level 50.

faq.answer: Raichu can be Shiny in Pok√©mon GO ‚ú®.
